column5: Going to Lac Seul for the first time this July. I have a Globalmap 3000MT (same as x15) and I am looking for a chip that might work up there. I know I can't run the premium chip from hotmaps, so I am wondering if there is anything else I can use. Even just the land background would be helpful. Is there a mapcreate for Canada? I have also read the archives and heard about Freedom maps? Any ideas would be appreciated.
Look into a Canada Topo map card/software, this would not have any water depth info but the shoreline should be much more developed.
Lowrance sells the Freedom Maps, F-40T it covers North Ontario and part of Manitoba. The map is exactly like a good paper map of the lakes. No depth, shows all streets, roads, highways also. $99.00
